snippet: In a New York magazine cover article titled "The Emasculation of Wall Street," Gabriel Sherman writes that the end of the bonus boom has been even more terrifying than the financial crash was four years ago.
abstract: In a New York magazine cover article titled "The Emasculation of Wall Street," Gabriel Sherman writes that the end of the bonus boom has been even more terrifying than the financial crash was four years ago.
lead_paragraph: In a New York magazine cover article titled "The Emasculation of Wall Street," Gabriel Sherman writes that the end of the bonus boom has been even more terrifying than the financial crash was four years ago. Mr. Sherman reports that "with all the major banks unable to wager their own funds on big bets, there's a growing sense that the money that was being made during the Bush boom won't be back." Read more »
